issue.title: Derive enum option value's Starlark convertibility

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Instead of hardcoding the list of enums that are Starlark convertible, use `StarlarkValue` as a marker interface.

Also make `--strip` Starlark convertible, which is the original motivation for this change.

Fixes #26548

body: Could you test https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/26558? I ended up refactoring how Bazel handles option convertibility for enums and did allowlist `--strip` along the way.

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 8.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.4.0rc1. Thanks!
